title: New Zealand Citizen Family Relationship visa
summary: This page provides detailed information about the New Zealand Citizen Family Relationship visa (Subclass 461), a temporary 5‑year visa for non‑New Zealand citizens who are family members of New Zealand citizens. It outlines visa conditions, eligibility criteria, costs, processing times, obligations, and how to apply.

structured_data.visa_name: New Zealand Citizen Family Relationship visa
structured_data.description: A temporary visa for individuals who are not New Zealand citizens but are members of the family unit of a New Zealand citizen, allowing them to live, work, and study in Australia for five years.

key_updates.details: Applicants can import their paper application into ImmiAccount.

stay.travel_rights: Unlimited travel to and from Australia during the 5-year visa period.

notes: Use the visa processing time guide tool for an indication of recent processing times.
Processing times are not specific to individual applications.
factors_that_delay_processing: Missing documents or additional information requests

with_this_visa: Travel to and from Australia multiple times

general_requirements: Applicant must not be a New Zealand citizen at time of application.
Applicant must meet health and character requirements.
Applicant must not be an Australian citizen.

citizenship_conditions.not_an_australian_citizen: You cannot be granted this visa if you are an Australian citizen.
citizenship_conditions.not_a_new_zealand_citizen: You cannot be granted this visa if you are a New Zealand citizen.
citizenship_conditions.if_become_nz_citizen_during_processing: You may continue the application or withdraw it and apply for a Subclass 444 visa.
citizenship_conditions.note_on_nz_citizenship: Certain persons may not be eligible for New Zealand citizenship by descent; see New Zealand government website.

categories: You must be a member of the family unit of a New Zealand citizen who is not an eligible New Zealand citizen and who is either in Australia as the holder of a Subclass 444 visa or will travel with you and be granted a Subclass 444 visa on entry.
notes: New Zealand family member must have or be eligible for a Subclass 444 visa.
New Zealand citizens are not automatically granted a Subclass 444 visa.

conditions: Family members must meet health and character requirements.
Family members must be included at the time of application; no additions after lodgement.

newborn_children.note: A child born to a New Zealand citizen parent in Australia may not be eligible for New Zealand citizenship by descent.

notes: You cannot stay in Australia after your visa expires unless you hold another visa.
You can apply for a further Subclass 461 visa if eligible.

location_rules: You can be in or outside Australia when applying, but not in immigration clearance.
If applying as an offshore applicant, you should lodge and remain outside Australia until the acknowledgment letter is issued.
additional_notes: You can only enter Australia if holding a visa that is in effect.
See Step-by-Step section for application process.
See Visa outcome section for details on required location at grant time.

travel.rights: You may travel outside Australia and return as many times as you want during the 5‑year visa period.

visa_label.information: Visa is digitally linked to passport; no physical label is issued.

administrative_recommendations: Complete health examinations and character checks before lodging.
Submit a complete application for faster processing.
